items.title: NVIDIA posts strong Q4 results; Q1 revenue guide above consensus
items.summary: Material watchlist catalyst: NVIDIA reported Q4 FY2026 revenue of $68.1B and guided Q1 to $78B ±2%, above pre-print consensus and likely supportive for AI-capex complex (NVDA/AVGO/TSM/MSFT/GOOG).

items.title: USTR says U.S. tariff rate will rise to 15% or higher for some countries
items.summary: Material macro escalation: Reuters reports USTR signaled some country rates move from 10% to 15%+, increasing policy-risk premium across globally exposed watchlist names.

items.title: Provisional: U.S. official says no Nvidia H200 chips sold to Chinese customers yet
items.summary: Single-source Reuters official comment suggests continued U.S.-China AI-chip export friction, keeping NVDA/TSM ecosystem policy risk premium active.

items.title: U.S. judge lets anti-American hiring-bias lawsuit against Tesla proceed
items.summary: Material TSLA legal development: Reuters reports a U.S. judge declined to dismiss a hiring-discrimination suit, extending litigation/regulatory overhang.

items.title: White House says U.S. is working to raise temporary global tariff from 10% to 15%
items.summary: Material macro policy escalation: Reuters says the administration is working to lift the temporary tariff rate to 15%, raising cross-asset risk premium.

items.title: U.S. implements additional 10% tariff on non-exempt goods
items.summary: Material macro update: Reuters reported an additional 10% U.S. tariff on non-exempt imports, sustaining tariff-driven risk-off and watchlist supply-chain sensitivity.

items.title: Tesla $243M Autopilot crash verdict upheld by U.S. judge
items.summary: Material TSLA legal development: federal judge upheld a $243M Autopilot-related jury verdict, extending litigation overhang for autonomy strategy.

items.title: Tesla sues California DMV over false-advertising ruling
items.summary: Material regulatory/legal development for TSLA as it challenges California DMV's ruling related to Autopilot/FSD marketing claims.

items.title: IBM drops ~13% on Anthropic COBOL-tooling disruption narrative
items.summary: IBM suffered an unusually large single-session decline as investors repriced legacy modernization exposure after Anthropic's COBOL automation update.

items.title: Update: tariff shock broadens into deeper risk-off move
items.summary: Follow-through selling indicates tariff-policy shock is now an active de-risking event. Most exposed watchlist names: NVDA, AVGO, TSLA, AAPL, MSFT, GOOG, TSM.

items.title: Macro trade-policy shock (U.S. tariffs legal whipsaw)
items.summary: Policy whipsaw around U.S. tariffs increased uncertainty and triggered a risk-off tone.
